thread.title: Plantronics tops Street 1Q forecasts

title: Plantronics tops Street 1Q forecasts
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Mon, Jul 27, 2015, 21:19 BST - UK Markets closed Plantronics tops Street 1Q forecasts Plantronics beats 1Q earnings and revenue expectations Associated Press â€“ 6 minutes ago 56.10 -0.35 
SANTA CRUZ, Calif. (AP) _ Plantronics Inc. (PLT) on Monday reported fiscal first-quarter net income of $21.2 million. 
The Santa Cruz, California-based company said it had profit of 55 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to 67 cents per share. 
The results surpassed Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of three analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 63 cents per share. 
The headset maker posted revenue of $206.4 million in the period, which also topped Street forecasts. Four analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $205.4 million. 
For the current quarter ending in September, Plantronics expects its per-share earnings to range from 58 cents to 66 cents. 
The company said it expects revenue in the range of $202 million to $212 million for the fiscal second quarter. Analysts surveyed by Zacks had expected revenue of $208.3 million. 
Plantronics shares have climbed almost 6 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Monday, shares hit $56.11, a climb of 20 percent in the last 12 months. 

This story was generated by Automated Insights (http://automatedinsights.com/ap) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on PLT at http://www.zacks.com/ap/PLT
